blog.name: ventoserenowrites
blog.title: VentoSereno
blog.description:
A Remadora fic blog, with intersectional feminist content [by someone who really ought to be getting on with other things]. 
Do I understand how Tumblr works? Can't say that I do, no. But I do sound like I'm from London. Find the rest of my scribblings on A03!

title: Quidditch
body:
I write on A03.

It’s match day. The sky is a perfect bright blue and a gentle breeze is fluttering the flags and banners that adorn the quidditch pitch.

The school is out in force for what is the first Quidditch match of the new school year. Post-battle. Post-Voldemort. A clear sign of the school’s return to normality.

Harry and Ron are heading down to the changing rooms, the usual pre-game excitement turning Harry’s stomach, Ron looking positively green with nerves.

As they pass behind the stands they see a now familiar sight around the school – the long, lean form of Remus Lupin, holding a turquoise headed baby, the smaller figure of Tonks by his side. Harry and Ron are about to call out a greeting but stop in their tracks.

“What the hell…” splutters Ron.

Teddy is fully decked out in yellow and black stripes, with matching hat, gloves and scarf, his chubby face sporting badger whiskers. His mother is dressed in the same get up. She is currently trying to coax the baby into changing his hair by morphing hers to yellow, then black, and then stripes of both colours.

Teddy is giggling and gurgling but obviously distracted. “I think it’s too difficult for him. Look at mummy Teddy bear. You’ve done yellow before. Try it again, like this!”

Before Harry can restrain him, Ron has approached them. Dispensing with the usual “hellos” and “how are yous”, he points to Tonks and demands “What are you doing?”

Remus shakes his head at him from behind his wife’s back, but it’s too late. Tonks fixes him with a glare. “We’re dressing up for the match, of course.”

“But we’re playing against Hufflepuff, Tonks.” Says Ron, in his most reasonable yet condescending tone.

“Right. And Teddy will likely be a Hufflepuff. Like his mother and grandfather before him.”

Ron stares at her in disbelief.

“But his father is the head of Gryffindor house!”

“So? Are you saying that a father’s influence is more important than a mother’s?”

“Well….no..” splutters Ron. “But…his godfather is captain of the Quidditch team! Think of the optics,Tonks” He looks proud of himself for having dredged up this excuse. “It’ll look bad, innit?”

“I’ve never much cared for what other people think, Ron, as I am sure you know. Anyway, when he is old enough, Teddy will probably play quidditch for Hufflepuff. Like I did.”

Ron, totally exasperated, looks to Harry and Remus. “You tell her! This is ridiculous!”

“We thought we’d train Teddy up to one day be Gryffindor captain.” Mumbles Harry, at the same time as Remus says, a placating hand on his wife’s arm “Darling, the boys are keen to have Teddy as their team’s mascot. I think it’s nice. And anyway, none of us can predict what house Teddy will end up in – he’ll have to make his own choice when the time comes.”

Tonks flashes her husband a glare. “I’m sorry – were you pregnant with Teddy for nine months? Did you spend over a day in labour pushing him out of your vagina? Did you spend a year at home, skulking about to avoid danger? No. So I say until he’s old enough to decide for himself, Teddy supports Hufflepuff. And if you boys don’t like it, you can lump it.”

Ron is so astonished he is lost for words. He continues to gesture towards Remus, then Harry, then the stands in turn, saying, in a tone of shocked disbelief “Hufflepuff! Over Gryffindor! ”

“That’s right, Weasley. We’d better find our seats, Remus.”

“Can we still have Teddy as our mascot?!” Harry calls after her, but she is already out of earshot.

Remus looks at the boys “Yes, of course you can, but don’t tell her I said so!” He looks around to his wife’s retreating back and says, hurriedly - “And whatever you’re planning on doing, please bear in mind that I do not want to spend the next month sleeping on the sofa. Good luck boys. Make Gryffindor proud.”

summary:
McGonagall: Mr.Black, do you care to explain yourself?
Sirius: dressing robe - kimono, kimono - dressing robe, it's the same...
body:
McGonagall: Mr.Black, do you care to explain yourself?

Sirius: dressing robe - kimono, kimono - dressing robe, it’s the same really

McGonagall: looks at the beaming Remus at Sirius side, *sighs* just don’t lose the belt

summary: You know what, I think we as a fandom don't give enough credit to how patient voldemort was, I mean he always waited to come...
body: You know what, I think we as a fandom don’t give enough credit to how patient voldemort was, I mean he always waited to come after harry at the end of the school year, that’s a lot of patience for a man who is so thirsty for killing a teenage boy

summary: Devon Travers - OPEN  Faction: Death Eaters Devon Travers has a secret. Though outwardly aggressively macho, his viciousness...
caption:
Devon Travers - OPEN
Faction: Death Eaters

Devon Travers has a secret. Though outwardly aggressively macho, his viciousness acts as the defensive walls hiding the person he both hates and wishes to truly be. Self-loathing curdles his world-view and as one of Lord Voldemort’s Death Eaters, he is given the outlet for the rage and hate that courses through him. At his core, however, fear reigns supreme.

Travers is a complicated character, steeped in prejudice, hatred and cruelty. If you’re looking for an interesting, challenging muse to explore, look no further!

-

CRIMSON BEGINNING - A psychological horror Harry Potter roleplay

For the intrepid and curious we offer:

  • Highly literate, and para-centric role-play
  • Dark and complicated themes (these plots are not for the faint of heart)
  • A steady paced, active, and fun-filled environment
  • A safe place to brainstorm or bounce ideas

Home || Rules || Apply || Navigation || FAQs

summary: "You call a star a star, and say it is just a ball of matter moving on a mathematical course. But that is merely how you see it....
body:
“You call a star a star, and say it is just a ball of matter moving on a mathematical course. But that is merely how you see it. By so naming things and describing them you are only inventing your own terms about them. And just as speech is invention about objects and ideas, so myth is invention about truth.”

-Humphrey Carpenter

This is the base for my previous post! Modern au, I guess? For Vega and Altair- or Harry and Tom.
